page.title: 20Events in Yewdale
page.content: On May 24th 1985,{H.M. the Queen visited Cumbria and passed through our block, stopping at{Tarn Hows}to meet representatives of the National Trust; from there she went to{High Yewdale {Farm}to meet the tenant, Mr. Birkett, and his family, who gave her an insight into the workings of a fell farm. Due to the heavy rain, a demonstration of shearing a Herdwick sheep had to be carried out under cover. Her Majesty travelled along Yewdale to Coniston, where the streets were lined with local schoolchildren. The potential danger of the fells was underlined by the search for a missing woman who disappeared on September 28th 1985. A number of {mountain rescue}teams combined in a week-long search, aided by helicopter, until the body was found. This was but one incident of many over the years.
